Typealiases.html#/s:18MobileSSOFramework.name: SessionCompletionListener
Typealiases.html#/s:18MobileSSOFramework.abstract: Typealias for most session method completion listeners. Either the session or the error parameter will be non-nil.

Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html#/s.name: initialized(session:)
Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html#/s.abstract: Will be called when the session state has been resolved. You should wait for this event before

Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html#/s.name: didResumeSession(session:)
Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html#/s.abstract: A session has been resumed succesfully. This will be called when the application returns to

Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html#/s.name: didLoseSession()
Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html#/s.abstract: A session has been lost. This can either happen when returning the app to foreground and detecting an

Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html#/s.name: didCompleteLogin(session:)
Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html#/s.abstract: User has completed the login flow succesfully and is now logged in.

Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html#/s.name: didRefreshSession(session:)
Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html#/s.abstract: A session was refreshed with a refresh token.

Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html#/s.name: didLogout()
Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html#/s.abstract: User has completed the logout process succesfully. Any session data will be invalid.

Protocols/MobileSSOAppDelegate.html.name: MobileSSOAppDelegate
Protocols/MobileSSOAppDelegate.html.abstract: Your AppDelegate must implement this protocol in order to make the login and logout flows work.

Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html.name: SessionManagerDelegate
Protocols/SessionManagerDelegate.html.abstract: Implement this protocol to get notified of changes to the session.

Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.name: invalidAppDelegateError
Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.abstract: The app’s AppDelegate is not compliant with MobileSSO. The AppDelegate must implement

Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.name: serviceConfigLoadError
Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.abstract: The service configuration could not be loaded.

Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.name: authStateParseError
Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.abstract: The auth state could not be parsed from the server response. This indicates a bug in either the

Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.name: tokenRequestError
Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.abstract: Token exchange request could not be created. This indicates a bug in MobileSSO framework.

Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.name: sessionRefreshNoSessionError
Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.abstract: The session could not be refreshed because no session exists.

Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.name: sessionRefreshOauthError
Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.abstract: The server rejected the refresh token. The refresh token is most probably expired.

Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.name: sessionRefreshNetworkError
Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.abstract: Network error occurred (e.g. no internet connection) while refreshing the session.

Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.name: sessionRefreshServerError
Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.abstract: Server returned an error while refreshing the session. This might indicate a server issue.

Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.name: logoutErrorNoEndSessionURL
Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.abstract: The service configuration did not contain an URL for ending the session.

Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.name: logoutErrorNetworkError
Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.abstract: Network error occurred (e.g. no internet connection) while trying to log out.

Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.name: logoutErrorServerError
Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html#/s:FO.abstract: Server returned an error while logging out. This might indicate a server issue.

Enums/SessionStatus.html#/s:FO18MobileSS.name: expired
Enums/SessionStatus.html#/s:FO18MobileSS.abstract: The session has expired and needs refresh.

Enums/MobileSSOLoggingLevel.html#/s:FO18.name: info
Enums/MobileSSOLoggingLevel.html#/s:FO18.abstract: All log messages are printed to the console.

Enums/MobileSSOLoggingLevel.html#/s:FO18.name: warning
Enums/MobileSSOLoggingLevel.html#/s:FO18.abstract: Warning level messages are printed to the console. This is recommended for application

Enums/MobileSSOLoggingLevel.html#/s:FO18.name: error
Enums/MobileSSOLoggingLevel.html#/s:FO18.abstract: Error level messages are printed to the console. These messages indicate either a direct misuse

Enums/MobileSSOLoggingLevel.html#/s:FO18.name: none
Enums/MobileSSOLoggingLevel.html#/s:FO18.abstract: No messages will be printed from MobileSSOFramework.

Enums/MobileSSOLoggingLevel.html.name: MobileSSOLoggingLevel
Enums/MobileSSOLoggingLevel.html.abstract: The logging level of the MobileSSO framework. A good value for application development is

Enums/PersonType.html.name: PersonType
Enums/PersonType.html.abstract: The type of the person resource. Currently only supported type is person.

Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html.name: SessionManagerErrorCode
Enums/SessionManagerErrorCode.html.abstract: All possible errors that can occur while managing sessions.

Enums/LoginState.html.name: LoginState
Enums/LoginState.html.abstract: Intermediate login states for UI flow management.

Global Variables.html#/s:v18MobileSSOFra.name: SessionManagerErrorDomain
Global Variables.html#/s:v18MobileSSOFra.abstract: The error domain of SessionManager. All errors from this class will use this string.

Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:vC18Mobil.name: delegates
Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:vC18Mobil.abstract: All registered delegates. Note that the references are stored with weak strongness.

Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:FC18Mobil.name: removeDelegate(_:)
Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:FC18Mobil.abstract: Remove a delegate from the SessionManager. You will only need to call this if you want to

Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:vC18Mobil.name: initialized
Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:vC18Mobil.abstract: The SessionManager status. You should not use the methods of this class until this property is true

Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:vC18Mobil.name: currentSession
Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:vC18Mobil.abstract: The current session, if any. Use the framework initialization method (MobileSSO.initialize()) to try to

Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:FC18Mobil.name: getFreshSession(completion:)
Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:FC18Mobil.abstract: Will call completion listener with a fresh session. Auto-refreshes the tokens if necessary.

Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:FC18Mobil.name: presentLogin(in:extraScopes:acrValues:stateCompletion:completion:)
Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:FC18Mobil.abstract: Present the browser that will allow the user to log in and create a session.

Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:FC18Mobil.name: refreshSession(completion:)
Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:FC18Mobil.abstract: Try to refresh the session. Will update the currentSession with new tokens.

Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:FC18Mobil.name: logout(in:loadingCompletion:completion:)
Classes/SessionManager.html#/s:FC18Mobil.abstract: Logout the user. This method will first check if the session is still valid and then will open a logout URL in

Classes/IDTokenPayload.html#/s:vC18Mobil.name: iatRaw
Classes/IDTokenPayload.html#/s:vC18Mobil.abstract: The raw unix timestamp of the token issue time. See issuedAtTime for a Date version.

Classes/IDTokenPayload.html#/s:vC18Mobil.name: expRaw
Classes/IDTokenPayload.html#/s:vC18Mobil.abstract: The raw unix timestamp of the session expire time. See expirationTime for a Date version.

Classes/Session.html#/s:vC18MobileSSOFra.name: isAuthorized
Classes/Session.html#/s:vC18MobileSSOFra.abstract: Is true if the user is authorized.

Classes/Session.html#/s:vC18MobileSSOFra.name: accessToken
Classes/Session.html#/s:vC18MobileSSOFra.abstract: The current access token if a session exists.

Classes/Session.html#/s:vC18MobileSSOFra.name: refreshToken
Classes/Session.html#/s:vC18MobileSSOFra.abstract: The refresh token to refresh a session (you should not need to use this manually, see

Classes/Session.html#/s:vC18MobileSSOFra.name: scope
Classes/Session.html#/s:vC18MobileSSOFra.abstract: The raw string containing all the authorization scopes for the session.

Classes/Session.html#/s:vC18MobileSSOFra.name: idToken
Classes/Session.html#/s:vC18MobileSSOFra.abstract: The raw id token (in JWT format). The payload data is automatically parsed to the profile property.

Classes/Session.html#/s:vC18MobileSSOFra.name: idTokenPayload
Classes/Session.html#/s:vC18MobileSSOFra.abstract: The payload part of the JWT token in a more convenient format.

Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:vC18MobileSS.name: gluuUserId
Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:vC18MobileSS.abstract: The gluu person id. Can be used to match the person in Gluu. Matches the sub property of the id token payload.

Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:vC18MobileSS.name: personResourceId
Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:vC18MobileSS.abstract: The person resource id. Can be used to match the person in Qvarn.

Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:vC18MobileSS.name: revision
Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:vC18MobileSS.abstract: The revision field. This will update when the person resource changes in the backend.

Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:vC18MobileSS.name: fullName
Classes/UserProfile.html#/s:vC18MobileSS.abstract: A convenience accessor. Returns the full name of the first item in the names property array.

Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZvC18MobileSSO.name: loggingLevel
Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZvC18MobileSSO.abstract: The logging level of the MobileSSOFramework. When doing application development, a good value

Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZvC18MobileSSO.name: clientId
Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZvC18MobileSSO.abstract: The client id string of this application.

Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZvC18MobileSSO.name: loginRedirectUri
Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZvC18MobileSSO.abstract: The URL where the system browser will redirect after a successful login.

Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZvC18MobileSSO.name: logoutRedirectUri
Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZvC18MobileSSO.abstract: The URL where the system browser will redirect after a successful logout.

Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZvC18MobileSSO.name: clockSkewTolerance
Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZvC18MobileSSO.abstract: The allowed clock skew tolerance when validating the id token. Default is 120 seconds,

Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZFC18MobileSSO.name: initializeSDK()
Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZFC18MobileSSO.abstract: The entry point of the framework. This must be called before using any methods of the SessionManager.

Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZFC18MobileSSO.name: willEnterForeground()
Classes/MobileSSO.html#/s:ZFC18MobileSSO.abstract: When the application returns from an inactive state, this method should be called to ensure the

Classes/MobileSSO.html.name: MobileSSO
Classes/MobileSSO.html.abstract: A class that allows global access to all build variables and has the methods for initial

Classes/UserProfile.html.name: UserProfile
Classes/UserProfile.html.abstract: The user profile associated with the session.

Classes/Session.html.name: Session
Classes/Session.html.abstract: A class that holds information about the current session and its tokens (access, refresh, id tokens).

Classes/IDTokenPayload.html.name: IDTokenPayload
Classes/IDTokenPayload.html.abstract: A model that holds the profile payload data parsed from the JWT payload of the id token.

Classes/SessionManager.html.name: SessionManager
Classes/SessionManager.html.abstract: The main class for handling session status.
